brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study was to investigate the effect of i.v. infusion of magnesium sulphate
      during spinal anesthesia on duration of spinal block and postoperative pain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ASA physical status I and II, aged between 18 and 65 female patients undergoing
             abdominal hysterectomy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  severe cardiovascular, renal and hepatic dysfunction, neuromuscular diseases, using
             calcium channel blockers, and inappropriate for spinal anesthesia.

study_pop.textblock: 18 and 65 female patients undergoing abdominal hysterectomy

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Intravenous Magnesium Sulfate Infusion on Sensory Spinal Block and Postoperative Pain Score in Abdominal Hysterectomy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: The effect of intravenous magnesium sulfate infusion on sensory spinal block and postoperative pain score in abdominal hysterectomy

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
